programme.title: War Gamers
programme.desc: When WW2 breaks out between Britain and Germany, the Royal Navy must find a way to sink the German U-boats before they cut off their vital transatlantic shipping routes.

programme.title: War Gamers
programme.desc: Dönitz's U-boats continue to terrorize the transatlantic routes; in Britain, the WRENS prepare to frustrate his plans, while the Royal Navy turns to a retired wargamer.

programme.title: War Gamers
programme.desc: Gilbert Roberts sets up a tactical school to counter the U-boats; he enlists the help of Jean Laidlaw and a small team of Wrens to wargame battles and develop new maneuvers.

programme.title: War Gamers
programme.desc: Roberts and Laidlaw uncovered a flaw in the Royal Navy's anti-U-boat tactic "Buttercup"; they must convince Noble that their new maneuver will sink Dönitz's U-boats.

programme.title: War Gamers
programme.desc: In 1943, pressure mounts on WATU to prove their value; when convoy ONS.5 catches Dönitz's attention, the stage is set for the battle that will turn the tide of the Atlantic war.

programme.title: War Gamers
programme.desc: After ONS.5, Roberts and Laidlaw must do everything in their power to counteract Dönitz's acoustic torpedo and recapture the waves before the impending D-Day landings.

programme.desc: Distant ancestors were afraid of lightning and thought that it was sent by the gods; today, electricity is part of people's daily lives.

programme.desc: High-school students (James Marsden, Katie Holmes, Nick Stahl) suspect that sinister forces are controlling their too-perfect classmates.

programme.title: Better Man
programme.desc: The true story of the meteoric rise, dramatic fall, and remarkable resurgence of British pop superstar Robbie Williams.

programme.title: Life Is Beautiful
programme.desc: With a game, an Italian Jew (Roberto Benigni) shields his son (Giorgio Cantarini) from Nazi horrors in a concentration camp during World War II.

programme.title: Adventureland
programme.desc: A college grad (Jesse Eisenberg) takes a lowly job at an amusement park after his parents refuse to fund his long-anticipated trip to Europe.

programme.title: The Heartbreak Kid

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee
programme.desc: A rich reporter tours outback Australia with a crocodile hunter, then brings him to Manhattan.

programme.title: Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure

programme.title: Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey
programme.desc: The dopey dudes (Keanu Reeves, Alex Winter) beat the Grim Reaper (William Sadler) in a board-game contest, so he must help them stop their evil robot twins.

programme.title: Bill & Ted Face the Music
programme.desc: The ruler of the future tells best friends Bill and Ted they must compose a new song to save life as we know it. But instead of writing it, they decide to travel through time to steal it from their older selves and bring harmony to the universe.

programme.title: Hour of the Gun
programme.desc: Wyatt Earp (James Garner) deputizes Doc Holliday (Jason Robards) and forms a posse to hunt Ike Clanton (Robert Ryan) and his gang.

programme.title: The Killing
programme.desc: The organizers of a brilliantly conceived racetrack heist find their perfect crime beginning to unravel.

programme.title: No Way Out
programme.desc: The secretary of Defense (Gene Hackman) forces a Pentagon naval aide (Kevin Costner) to lead a manhunt for a Soviet spy during a murder cover-up.

programme.title: Soul Plane

programme.desc: Two life sentences for a 1947 double murder land an innocent man (Tim Robbins) in a corrupt Maine penitentiary.

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqué, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqué, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.
